result.execSummary:
The defendant Maria Veronica Organista-Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $42 paid prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $4.20 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maria Veronica Organista-Guzman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:24 p.m. Defendant Maria Veronica Organista-Guzman in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski. Enrique Soria present to interpret. Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Sulewski. Statement by DE. Court orders: Restitution in the amount of $42 which has previously been paid, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Spanish Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Andrew John Sulewski in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sulewski requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Maria Veronica Organista-Guzman in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interperter.  Atty Sulewski requests slight adjournment on STC.  Court grants request of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:15 PM: Defendant Maria Veronica Organista-Guzman in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Interpreter oath given by the Court.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.   Def does not wish counsel today and states that she went back and paid for the items.  Def is not currently employed.  Court believes that Def is wishing to contest the charges as filed.  Def is referred to SPD for eligibility.  Def to meet with SPD today as Court believes she will qualify for services.   NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
